Summary 15 Years Chief of Staff, Sales, Business Operations Management, Change Management and Program Management experience. Experience includes: Project management and change management experience for large scale people, process and systems changes. Global Business Operations Experience Sr Business Operations Manager, Service Provider Cisco Systems July 2014  – Present (1 year 2 months) San Francisco Bay Area Chief of Staff for Development Solutions, Services and Operations Chief of Staff for Engineering Operations and Systems Development (EOSD) March 2013  –  July 2014  (1 year 5 months) San Jose, CA Provide executive support in driving the operational functions for over 1,700 Development employee's in support of the VP of DSSO and his leadership staff, thus enabling them to concentrate their time, effort and priorities on strategic initiatives.  
 
Core responsibilities are: Solutions portfolio management. Manage quarterly operational reviews & all hands. Develop and drive operational rewards and recognition program and processes. Craft and communicate monthly “Top of Mind” communications (via web, blogs, and video’s) from Sr. VP Management. Partner with HR to ensure organizational alignment to the proper HR programs and processes.  
 
Develop, implement and manage the ongoing philanthropy program across 1100 FTE’s. Manage global executive presence opportunities and maintain overall vision and purpose of the opportunities (while traveling to participate in the global GEO trips). Implement and own quarterly All Managers Meetings to ensure we stay close in step with our first line managers to ensure the health and happiness of our employees and take embrace feedback to make the appropriate changes upstream.  
 
Partner with Finance to drive monthly headcount and budget decisions and discussions across the Leadership team.  
 
Drive strategy and vision alignment across the Development Operations teams while also managing all VP level communications and overall chief of staff function to ensure the health of the organization. Business Operations Manager - Go To Market Business Operations Cisco Systems May 2012  –  March 2013  (11 months) San Jose, CA Go To Market – Business Operations Manager 
Lead a cross segment forum to bring Smart Solutions Ops teams together to drive cadence and governance across all Smart Solutions.  
Lead executive Cloud review board to drive Cloud strategy, address escalations and approve and implement policy changes.  
 
Achievements: 
•	Defined, socialized and implemented a cross organizational Cloud Compensation Operating model to ensure program integrity and efficiency. 
•	Developed a playbook template for a repeatable process for smart solution GTM definition/execution; leveraging Remote Expert as the “example” to work from.  
•	Developed and lead an Advisory Panel w/ Cloud Executives to drive our strategy, budgets and policy.  
o	Cloud Comp Operating Model and Advisory Panel has been defined as the model that should be used across all GTM Smart Solutions going forward. Engineering Business Operations Manager Cisco Systems November 2011  –  May 2012  (7 months) Lead the Executive Leadership team within Cisco Engineering to set & implement an operating model & cadence that delivers predictability, simplification, and accountability. 
 
Co-Lead FY 13 Engineering Whole Offer Prioritization efforts with Executive Leadership. Defined Process and Calendar to drive prioritization efforts. Supported and lead Change Management effotts to socialize process and calendar. 
 
Achievements:  
•	Co-Lead FY 13 Engineering Whole Offer Prioritization efforts with Executive Leadership. Defined Process and Calendar to drive prioritization efforts. Supported and lead Change Management efforts to socialize process and calendar.  
•	Established an ongoing cadence and process for Exec Level Action item capture, storage and follow up.  
•	Created and Managed Executive Level Cisco Quad (IWE) spaces to track and manage Monthly Meeting results and action items. 
•	Researched and Crafted an Engineering Operations Mobile Mail policy and obtained executive level agreement/buy in.  
•	Shadowed current Senior Director in a “Chief of Staff” role. Responsible for resolving organizational issues or addressing organizational questions (I.e. rolling out a pipeline tool used by Sales, Establishing CAP reporting for our Business Group leaders etc). Business Operations Mgr Cisco Systems March 2010  –  November 2011  (1 year 9 months) San Jose, CA AS Architecture Program Manager: 
Lead a highly complex and diverse global and cross functional team to expand Cisco DC Services Capabilities ( Portfolio, Scale, Reach) to accelerate Cisco DC Arch leadership & Market share growth. 
 
Manage a cross Investment Budget ($202 Million for FY 12) across the Borderless, Collaboration and Data Center Architectures. Responsible for governing the Investment spending to instill ease of forecasting, reporting and streamlined shared practice cost allocation. Lead a global and cross functional team to identify and mange the evolution of the Services Delivery organization and articulate the changes into System, People and Process Impacts.
